PointerButtonEvent Class Reference

#include <PointerButtonEvent.h>

Inheritance diagram for PointerButtonEvent:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The event that a button of the pointer (mouse, joystick etc.) is pressed or released.

The input handling of the adapter instantiates this class and adds them to the desktop's event queue by using its addEvent() method.

See also:
Desktop::addEvent()

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PointerButtonEvent (  bool  option1,
bool  option2,
bool  pressed,
bool  primary
) 
 

Creates a new pointer button event.

Parameters:
option1 Whether the option button 1 is currently pressed, e.g. on Windows systems, this is the SHIFT key.
option2 Whether the option button 2 is currently pressed, e.g. on Windows systems, this is the CTRL key.
pressed The button was pressed (otherwise, it was released).
primary The primary (select) button caused the event. Otherwise, it is the secondary (context) button.

Member Function Documentation

void cancelFocusLossPopups (  EventTarget *  hitTarget  )  [private]
 

Destroys all popup windows on top of a given hit popup, or destroys all popup windows, if the given hit target is no popup at all.

Parameters:
hitTarget The target hit by the pointer.

void collectAncestors (  ArrayList< EventTarget > &  ancestors,
EventTarget *  eventTarget
)  [private]
 

Fills a given ArrayList with a event target and all its ancestors, in that order.

Parameters:
ancestors The ArrayList to be filled.
eventTarget The event target to start with.
